org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed

Class ConsedUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed.ConsedUtil

  • public final class ConsedUtil
extends Object
    This class contains utility scripts for converting AceContig data into data that can work with Consed.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Detail

      • convertAceGapsToContigGaps

        public static String convertAceGapsToContigGaps(String basecallsWithAceGaps)
        Convert a string of basecalls with '*' to represent gaps (which is what consed uses) with '-' instead.
        Parameters:
        basecallsWithAceGaps - a string of basecalls with the '*' to represent gaps.
        Returns:
        a new string with all the '*' converted into '-'.

      • generateDefaultPhdInfoFor

        public static PhdInfo generateDefaultPhdInfoFor(File traceFile,
                                                String readId,
                                                Date phdDate)

      • split0xContig

        public static SortedMap<Range,AceContig> split0xContig(AceContigBuilder contigBuilder,
                                                       boolean adjustIdCoordinates)
        Split a contig which may contain zero coverage areas (0x) into multiple contigs which all have at least some coverage at every location. If the given contig is split, the new contigs will be named <original_id>_<ungapped reference 1-based start>_<ungapped reference 1-based end>

        Some Assemblers (mostly reference assemblers) create contigs with zero coverage regions (0x) but that have the reference basecalls as the consensus in those areas. This method removes the parts of the contig which only have consensus.

        Parameters:
        contigBuilder - an AceContig that may have 0x regions. Can not be null.
        adjustIdCoordinates - this contig id already has coordinates appended to the end of the id, adjust these coordinates instead of appending new ones...
        Returns:
        a SortedMap of (possibly new) AceContigs of the broken given contig. The keys of the map are the Ranges into the original contig where these contigs are placed and the values of the map are the (possibly new) AceContigs. If there are no 0x regions in the given contig, then a Map containing one entry containing the Range covered and the reference of the given contig is returned.

      • isContigRename

        public static boolean isContigRename(ConsensusAceTag consensusTag)
        Checks to see if the given ConsensusAceTag is denotes that the contig has been renamed.
        Parameters:
        consensusTag - the tag to check.
        Returns:
        true if this tag denotes a contig rename; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consensusTag is null.

      • getRenamedContigId

        public static String getRenamedContigId(ConsensusAceTag contigRenameTag)
        Get the new name this contig should be named according to the given rename tag.
        Parameters:
        contigRenameTag - a ConsensusAceTag that denotes the contig has been renamed.
        Returns:
        the new name that the contig should be renamed to.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if contigRenameTag is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given tag is not a contig rename tag or if the tag text does not match the known pattern for contig renames.

      • getAceFile

        public static File getAceFile(File editDir,
                              String filenamePrefix,
                              int version)
        Get the ace file from the given editDir with the given ace file prefix and the given version.
        Parameters:
        editDir - the consed edit dir the ace file is in, if this parameter is null, then no editDir exists.
        filenamePrefix - prefix to ace file name before the ".ace.$version"; can not be null.
        version - the ace version number; must be ≥ 1
        Returns:
        the File to that ace file; or null if the specified ace does not exist or the editDir is null .
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if version < 1.

      • getLatestAceFile

        public static File getLatestAceFile(File editDir,
                                    String filenamePrefix)
        Gets the latest ace file with the given prefix in the given edit_dir.

        Consed labels each version of the ace file with a incrementing * value so prefix.ace.2 is newer than prefix.ace.1.

        Parameters:
        editDir - the consed edit_dir folder to inspect. If this parameter is null, then this method will return null.
        filenamePrefix - the beginning part of the file name to filter, incase there are more than 1 groups of versioned assemblies.
        Returns:
        the File object representing the latest version of the ace file with the given prefix in the given edit_dir; null if no such file exists or if editDir is also null.

      • generateNextAceFileFor

        public static File generateNextAceFileFor(File editDir,
                                          String filenamePrefix)

        public static File getPhdDirFor(File consedDir)

      • getEditDirFor

        public static File getEditDirFor(File consedDir)
        Get the File representing the Consed "edit_dir" of this consed package.
        Parameters:
        consedDir - the consed dir to use; can not be null, but might not exist.
        Returns:
        a new File object with representing the edit_dir, this File may not exist on the file system.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consedDir is null.

      • getConsedDirFor

        public static File getConsedDirFor(File aceFile)
        Get the root consed directory for the given ace file.
        Parameters:
        aceFile - the ace file to use; can not be null but does not have to exist.
        Returns:
        a File which may or may not exist
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if aceFile is null.

      • getAcePrefixFor

        public static String getAcePrefixFor(File aceFile)
        Gets the part of the ace file name before the ".ace" part. This method works on files that end in either ".ace" or ".ace.\d+".
        API Note:
        This is the same as 
          getAcePrefixFor(aceFile.getName())
        Parameters:
        aceFile - the ace File whose name is to be parsed; can not be null.
        Returns:
        the part of the name before ".ace".
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if aceFile is null.
        See Also:
        getAcePrefixFor(String)

      • getAcePrefixFor

        public static String getAcePrefixFor(String aceFileName)
        Gets the part of the ace file name before the ".ace" part. This method works on files that end in either ".ace" or ".ace.\d+".
        Parameters:
        aceFileName - the ace file name to parse; can not be null.
        Returns:
        the part of the name before ".ace".
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if aceFileName is null.
